ATTENTION!

TRAVELLERS!

Touchoom Hills House

This House is now open for the accommodation of the Public. Travellers will find it to their advantage to patronise this House, as they will be assured of comfort and good food at reasonable prices.

Louis Couture, Proprietor.

Real Estate Exchange.

Auditors, Valuers, Real Estate, Commissioners and Insurance Agents.

PRINCE ALBERT.

WAREHOUSING AT FORT QU'APPELLE

The undersigned having ample accommodation, are prepared to receive goods at reasonable rates, and will forward them at Fort Qu'Appelle until such time as reasonable rates.

JACKSON & JACKSON,

A consignment of Harrows, Seeders, Etc., has just arrived.

Parties who have ordered or who wish to purchase will please call.

JACKSON & JACKSON,

W. R. WATT, B.A.

Harvester, Solicitor, Publican, Surveyor, Etc.

Land bought and sold, Money invested, Land let out for J. Fenton & Co., Rent Estate Office, Hamilton, Ont.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

GEO. A. WATSON.

Law Officer, Mr. Campbell's Bookstore.

WILLIAM V. MACLISE.

Harvester, Solicitor, Etc.

Offices—Upstairs in Jackson's Block, next door to Farmers' House.

STEPHEN COCHRANE.

Harvester, Solicitor, Commissioner, Notary Public, Real Estate Agent, Etc.

Office—Second flat, First building on the north side of Main Street, between Walker & Baker stores. Entrance West end.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

S. ELLIOT.

Harvester, Solicitor, Notary Public, Etc.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

D. A. BLACKHORSE.

DENTIST.

Office—Jackson's Drug Store, after the 15th of May.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

A. PORTER, M.D.

PHYSICIAN AND SURGEON.

---

ITEMS OF INTEREST.

Rev. Daniel Perrett, member of Maj. Forsyth's party, died in the Hotel Des Nations, Kingston.

The Prince Albert Times is glad that spring is at hand; the snow is now melting over most of the country.

Seven-ton locomotives passed through St. Paul for the Canadian Pacific Saturday afternoon.

The time for disagreement with your neighbour is past; you must keep him out of your garden as he has been out of his own.

Cold, Casey, who defended the property of the late Mr. Macdonald when he was killed in Zululand, is dead.

The population of Macdonald is growing in the city of Tokyo, Japan, where the question of the election of the twelfth President was discussed.

It is rumored in Ottawa that Mr. Forrester is about to become Premier, but it is said that the Marquis of Lorne's successor is more likely to be the Governor-General of Canada.

The latest news from Australia is worrying by female experts. Four of these American women have been arrested for selling goods in the style of Grace Roman, and large sums of money have been stolen.

The business between St. Paul and Winnipeg is booming; the rolling stock of the Canadian Pacific is being loaded though the latter is being reinforced as rapidly as possible.

Australia has not escaped the prevailing storm, and the western portion of the country is suffering from floods. In Queensland thunderstorms have caused considerable damage to crops and sheep.

The weather has been very cool for the eight hours movement in the United States. Nevertheless the workmen in the mines have been obliged to work only eight hours a day, without any compensation.

The higher education of women is not yet complete. The University of Western Ontario has decided to allow ladies college courses, but the students must be in the second year of their studies.

It is said that the new law will make it easier for women to enter the professions.

Notice of Dissolution.

BRADNOBER.

Notice of Time and Place will only appear.

GREY EAGLE.

MARES THIS SEASON.

REPLY

PRINCE ALBERT, Feb. 27, 1883.

I am obliged to acknowledge receipt of your letter of this date, requesting me to allow myself to be brought forward as a candidate for the North West Council at the ensuing election.

I have much pleasure in accepting your request, and I am willing to further the interests not only of the District of Larne, but of the whole North West, should I be called to represent you in the Council.

I am, Gentlemen,

Yours truly,

D. H. MACDOWALL.

---

A MEETING WILL BE HELD IN THE TIMES OFFICE Thursday, the 26th of April, AT 10 O'CLOCK.

To arrange a programme of games for the 24th of May.

BANKING HOUSE

or Macarthur & Knowles.

Prince Albert, N.W.T.

---

It is rumored in Ottawa that Mr. Forrester is about to become Premier, but it is said that the Marquis of Lorne's successor is more likely to be the Governor-General of Canada.

PRINCE ALBERT, Feb. 27, 1883.

I am obliged to acknowledge receipt of your letter of this date, requesting me to allow myself to be brought forward as a candidate for the North West Council at the ensuing election.

I have much pleasure in accepting your request, and I am willing to further the interests not only of the District of Larne, but of the whole North West, should I be called to represent you in the Council.

I am, Gentlemen,

D. H. MACDOWALL.
PRINCE ALBERT TIMES

PRINCE ALBERT, APRIL 25, 1883

Mr. Blake will have deserved the thanks of the country for his patience and industry in the difficult task of surveying the large area of land which he has been engaged in surveying. The result of his labors will be known shortly.

The Government promises to provide for the expenses of the surveyors when they have completed their work.

The improvement of the Saskatchewan River is progressing rapidly. The House of Commons has approved the expenditure of $20,000 for the construction of a dam at the mouth of the river.

The Prince Albert Times

Prince Albert - N.W.T.
HUDSON'S BAY CO'Y.
FARMING LANDS!
FOR SALE IN
Manitoba & North-west

The Hudson's Bay Company owns 7,000,000 acres in the Great Fertile Belt, now offer for sale 600,000 acres already surveyed by the Government of Canada.

ALSO
TOWN LOTS
For Sale
In Winnipeg, West Lynne, Rat Portage, Fortage in Prairie and Bochum, N.W.T.

The above will be disposed of at reasonable prices and on easy terms of payment.

Full information in regard to these lands will be given at the offices of the Company in Winnipeg and Montreal.

C.J. BRADLEY, Land Commissioner
